------=_NextPart_000_000D_01C95528.97A007F0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Ken, Peter,
 
Have you tried separating patterns of growth from patterns of evolution.?
Specifically, are ontogenic patterns a separate concern from phylogenic
patterns?
 
Ken Lloyd


  _____  

From: neat@yahoogroups.com [mailto:neat@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
Kenneth Stanley
Sent: Wednesday, December 03, 2008 9:13 AM
To: neat@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [neat] Re: An improvement over object evolution with CPPNs



--- In neat@yahoogroups. <mailto:neat%40yahoogroups.com> com,
"petar_chervenski" <petar_chervenski@...>
wrote:
>
> 
> But I begin to wonder if this is the right thing for evolving 
> substrates or I was misled by the desire to have this Alife stuff 
> working or probably I forgot the basics again.. 
> 
> Peter
> 

Peter, I was curious that you said you are now not sure if your method
is the right way to evolve substrates. Why are you having second
thoughts? Do you think there still may be a non-growth way of doing it?

By the way, I was also wondering if you think that your method can
theoretically produce any configuration of nodes or if it is limited
to a small subset of possible density patterns? 

ken
